item.title: 8 Most Immersive Games That Have No Story
item.description:
Immersion is an integral aspect of many games, especially those driven by a core narrative thread. However, an immersive atmosphere can also elevate games that have no story at all, typically allowing them to be immediately fun to interact with.

Sound design, music, and visual presentation can have a massive impact on a player's immersion. However, game mechanics can be equally important, with emergent gameplay and aspects of simulation often supporting an immersive feel.

8 Dune: Spice Wars

Immersive & Thematic Mechanics In Slow-Burning Conquests

Dune: Spice Wars is an innovative combination of 4X and RTS mechanics that, while featuring no story, is supported by the iconic universe of Frank Herbert's Dune . This rich and detailed setting is lovingly recreated here, and supported further by immersive and thematic gameplay mechanics.

Dune: Spice Wars is designed around the harsh and hostile environments of Arrakis, with the dangers of its open desert ever-present in the moment-to-moment gameplay. Furthermore, the game's tactile sound design, subtle soundtrack, and stylish presentation provide an immersive backdrop.

7 Townscaper

A Deeply Atmospheric Low-Stakes Sandbox

Townscaper features no stakes, no story, no challenge. There are no goals or obstacles of any kind, instead offering players a truly tactile sandbox in which to build sprawling towns on soothing, all-encompassing waters.

This allows the game's atmosphere to take center stage, supported by colorful presentation and immersive sound design that provides a tranquil tone. For fans of mechanical experiences, Townscaper may be a disappointment, but players looking for a purely atmospheric game will likely enjoy this tactile distraction.

6 Project Zomboid

A Detailed Simulation Of A Zombie Apocalypse

Project Zomboid is a simulation of a zombie apocalypse that's elevated by its attention to detail and emergent gameplay. The level of detail present in its simulation and survival mechanics make for an immersive experience, providing players with emergent dangers and frequently encouraging them to risk their lives for valuable resources.

Project Zomboid features essentially no narrative threads, instead focusing almost entirely on survival gameplay. The game isn't afraid to let the player know they're not long for this world, and surviving for even a handful of days can prove difficult, but the immersive gameplay will be enough to keep certain players coming back.

5 Kenshi

Immersive Gameplay In A Strange & Hostile World

Kenshi is an open-world sandbox RPG that excels with its championing of player agency, providing diverse environments packed with interesting locations and characters. There's plenty to do in Kenshi , but there's no real narrative to follow, instead encouraging players to set their own goals and tell their own story in its desolate world.

While its presentation is somewhat lacking, Kenshi is supported by a vast array of detailed mechanics and RPG systems that allow for diverse gameplay. Squad-based combat, base-building, trading; there are many directions for players to take their characters, though danger lurks on all roads.

4 Lethal Company

Atmospheric Horror & Immersive Sound Design

Lethal Company is a co-operative first-person horror game that excels with its immersive atmosphere and variety of enemies. These distinctive threats feature diverse behaviors that facilitate emergent gameplay, supporting the already-immersive atmosphere.

This atmosphere is facilitated by immersive sound design, which is even more noticeable when using proximity voice chat in online co-op. The game's subtle music and minimalist presentation also help to build the creepy atmosphere, sparking the imagination of something fierce and filling the dark and empty corners of its environments with a foreboding sense of dread.

3 The Long Dark

Simulated Survival Elevated By An Immersive Atmosphere

​​​​​​​ The Long Dark is an immersive first-person survival game that excels with its simulation-heavy gameplay. The level of detail in its survival simulation provides immersive gameplay, but The Long Dark's greatest strength is arguably its uniquely soothing atmosphere.

This atmosphere is facilitated by a unique combination of natural environments and harsh gameplay; players could be fighting tooth and nail in one minute, and enjoying the warmth of a campfire in the next. This ebb and flow of respite and complete and present danger provides steep peaks and troughs in the feel of the game, heightening the emotions present at each point. In addition, The Long Dark is supported by stylish presentation and immersive sound design that elevates the overall experience all the more.

2 HROT

An Old-School FPS That Thrives On Its Surreal Atmosphere

HROT is a unique first-person shooter, sporting gunplay that's somewhat lacking and an art-style that's decidedly drab. However, the game's dismal presentation lends itself well to the game's downtrodden atmosphere, supported further by an eerie soundtrack and surrealist imagery.

Though its gameplay is competent, HROT excels with its immersive setting, offering players a surreal but ultimately grounded trip through a folksy, Czech-inspired country. Overall, the brutalist architecture, creepy enemies, and overall sense of dread provide a unique FPS experience, but players who aren't charmed by its atmosphere may find little to love.

1 Animal Well

An Exotic & Unexplained World

​​​​​​​ Animal Well plops players into its interconnected underground world with no explanation and only a vague sense of direction. Combined with a pixelated neon art-style, wildly atmospheric sound design, and an exotic soundtrack, Animal Well provides an immersive experience that constantly works to pique the player's curiosity.

The exotic nature of the game's world is particularly enthralling, populated by strange and enigmatic creatures and punctuated by diverse, alien environments. It's the heavily stylized presentation that lends a hand here, providing an aesthetic that's both natural and almost surreal at the same time. For fans of Metroidvanias that don't mind exploring a world with little explanation or closure, Animal Well is a mysterious and immersive gem.

item.title: The 25 Best House Mods For Skyrim Special Edition, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Skyrim's modding community offers a variety of housing mods, including estate-like homes and town-building opportunities.
  • Mods like "Build Your Noble House" and "Levelers Tower" enhance player experience by adding unique features to their homes.
  • Players can find mods like "Unlimited Bookshelves" and "Haven Bag" to personalize their gameplay and enhance storage options.

The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim is undoubtedly one of the best RPG titles of all time. When the game was released in November of 2011, players were blown away by the vast world, breathtaking landscapes, and engaging questlines. When Bethesda released Skyrim Special Edition , it breathed new life into the game for the modding community to take advantage of. This included a wealth of housing mods that went far beyond what the standard vanilla experience had to offer.

These mods allow players to live like virtual Kings and Queens in a variety of abodes both humble and grandiose. What's more, thanks to the tireless efforts of Skyrim modders looking for that perfect domicile to put their feet up after a long day of "Fus Ro Dah'ing" foes off the cliffside, more great Skyrim house mods are being created all the time. The modding community of this game continues to be highly active to this day, and it's easy to see why players can open the mod pages for Skyrim after months and still find new, well-decorated houses to mess around with!

Updated March 12, 2025, by Hamza Haq: Housing in Skyrim is definitely not the main focus of the game. Players can easily complete entire playthroughs that take over 100 hours without having seen the inside of a player's home. That said, the joy of Skyrim, and the reason why the game is still relevant today, is because its options are not limited to a single type of playstyle. Players can do what they want and not get punished for it. Best of all, modding has made Skyrim, well, modular, where prospective adventurers are free to slot in whatever catches their interest on a particular day to the game and simply run it. House mods for Skyrim range from simple hovels in the ground to wooden lodges in the wilderness to literal castles. Two new mods have been added to the list to give players even more player homes to browse for their next playthrough.

25 Aemer's Refuge SE

Downloads: 47,147

  • Creator: LeanWolf and masterofshadows
  • Download Link

Located south of Ivarstead, atop a high mountain peak, lies Aemer's Refuge , a mountain fortress that follows the design language of the city of Markarth. Players can lay claim to this beautiful stone castle by simply traveling to it and convincing the Refuge Spirit to let them in.

The Refuge Spirit also doubles as a helpful butler of sorts who can be summoned inside or outside the fortress to take the Dragonborn's extra items, bring the storage chest with him, or teleport the player directly to the player home. Additionally, features include auto-sorting, portals to all major hubs in the main game (and the DLCs), a Lift that isn't a loading screen, every single crafting station imaginable, and a hidden vault that works like a mini Legacy of the Dragonborn museum.

24 LC_Citadel

Downloads: 158,957

  • Creator: Locaster
  • Download Link

LC_Citadel adds not just a house to the game, but a whole city to go along with it. The Citadel is located just north of Whiterun near the base of the mountains. This Skyrim house mod comes with full lore and a progression system through which players can acquire the castle.

Players may not be able to access all areas of the castle immediately, but they can work up to it by following the progression system. This mod delivers the quintessential royal experience, thanks to the addition of an entire city built alongside the castle home.

23 Haven Bag

Downloads: 161,677

  • Creator: Haishao
  • Download Link

The Haven Bag mod adds an entire home in a bag that players can keep in their inventory, which is added when the mod is activated. Players can access it by selecting the bag in their inventory and using it. The Haven Bag comes with some basic amenities, a few crafting stations, and a bed to rest on.

The house is exited by reactivating the bag in the inventory, whereby players will find themselves back in Skyrim . They will not be able to take their followers inside the home, which means it's best suited for players who prefer to go solo throughout the province.

22 Ebongrove - Recall And Teleport SE

Downloads: 162,363

  • Creator: Undriel
  • Download Link

Ebongrove - Recall and Teleport SE adds a player home located in Eastmarch between the Eldregream Sanctuary and the ruins of Mzulft. Ebongrove is located inside a cave-like area that is illuminated by a Dwemer Sun and features interiors in the Dunmer style of décor.

Players with Dunmer or Dunmer-influenced characters will feel right at home with Ebongrove. The mod adds nearly all the crafting stations, up to eight beds, and even a small indoor fish pond, making it one of the most unique player house mods ever made.

21 Riverside Lodge

Downloads: 180,526

  • Creator: Lupus
  • Download Link

The Riverside Lodge is located smack dab in the middle of the area that falls between Whiterun and Riverwood. The location is excellent as much of the early game is spent adventuring back and forth between the two major cities and, later, Falkreath. The Lodge is a multi-tiered structure built into the landscape rather than on top of it. It neighbors the rapids waterfall along the road to Whiterun from Riverwood. A balcony overlooks the vista below, a gorgeous view that is especially breathtaking with the best graphics mods for Skyrim installed. There is a small, fenced-off garden to the side where players can grow vegetables and a stable by the river to house any horses that might need it.

The Riverside Lodge also comes equipped with a fully stocked kitchen, enchanting table, alchemy table, forge, and everything else a budding adventurer might need. A book placed on a table just outside the main structure allows players to alter or add certain rooms at will. A followers room, sorted storage containers, and custom master bedrooms to personalize the interior are all available to mess around with.

20 Dragon Keep SSE

Downloads: 187,221

  • Creator: ToppDog and KhrysINXS
  • Download Link

The Dragon Keep SSE adds a gigantic player home on a mountain peak almost directly in the middle of the map, west of Whiterun. All areas of Skyrim other than Riften are within reach. Dawnstar is to the north, Falkreath is to the south, and so on. The Dragon Keep itself contains more than just a place for players to stay; it serves as a boarding school for up to 12 orphan children, who come fully equipped with everything they need for anything they want to learn. Players can send children they find elsewhere to this school, which is under the supervision of adult NPCs who come prepackaged with the mod.

There are rooms dedicated to Alchemy, Enchanting, sword fighting, archery, and housing in separate sections of the Dragon Keep. Servants' quarters to house the help, a kitchen to prepare food for everyone, a dormitory for the students to sleep in, and much more. As the de facto principal, the Dragonborn can stay in private quarters inside the school or in a separate building just outside the main structure, which comes equipped with every amenity imaginable.

19 Lakeview Manor - As It Should Be

Downloads: 190,186

  • Creator: Nimee
  • Download Link

This mod does not add a new house, but rather takes an existing one added by the Hearthfires DLC and changes it into something worthy of the Dragonborn. Lakeview Manor - As It Should Be adds a dynamic lighting system, custom displays for all weapons and armor, a treasury, 6 beds for followers, two beds for children, and a functional bathtub with a toilet.

Players who want to enjoy something new, yet still want to keep close to the vanilla Skyrim experience will feel right at home with this mod. It's essentially a booster shot for an existing abode that boasts a few more bells and whistles.

18 Airship - Dev Aveza

Downloads: 205,772

  • Creator: Deapri
  • Download Link

The Dragonborn that likes to travel a lot will find right at home with Airship - Dev Aveza by Deapri. As the name suggests, the mod adds a flyable airship to the province of Skyrim which players can live in. The mod comes packed with the usual refinements including all the crafting tables, tons of storage, a kitchen, a bathing area, and displays for different weapons and armor.

The ship can be found parked behind the Blue Palace in Solitude, and players will have to battle a small group of Thalmor to get to it. Dev Aveza is one of the Skyrim house mods better suited for the single Dragonborn or one that has not adopted any children.

17 Unlimited Bookshelves

Downloads: 283,731

  • Creator: da5id2701
  • Download Link

Placing items on bookshelves is pretty great, but there's only a limited number of items that can be placed before players end up without any space. This can be pretty disappointing, especially since bookshelves clearly have more space for items than the game allows.

This issue becomes a thing of the past with the Unlimited Bookshelves mod , which does precisely what is stated in the title. It's a small change, but players will love just how many items they can stuff into these bookshelves with no issues whatsoever.

16 Rayek's End - SSE Expanded Edition

Downloads: 326,202

  • Creator: Rayek
  • Download Link

There are several custom-made hubs and homes that are available in the form of mods. Rayek's End is one of the most popular ones that allows players to enjoy a secluded retreat and relax as they hear the sound of a waterfall while getting their bearings together.

This modded hideout contains a display room and an underground garden where players can spend some time too. All in all, Rayek's End is one of the better custom Skyrim house mods that players should check out.

15 Whitepeak Tower - Dawnguard Themed Player Home

Downloads: 307,945

  • Creator: balcer
  • Download Link

Whitepeak Tower adds a Dawnguard theme player home on a small hill in the plains on the outskirts of Whiterun. The key to the house can be found inside a nearby wooden tree stump. The interior is statuesque and feels like the residence of a local Jarl or a noble instead of a regular player home, with mood lighting, carpets, drapes, and high-quality furniture.

The tower is split into six different floors, first is a basement with esoteric stuff, one is a dining space, then there is a display room with multiple ways to showcase the player's items, an expansive bedroom for the Dragonborn to sleep, one floor solely for any followers and kids the player adopts who need beds to sleep in, and one laboratory with multiple crafting stations. There is also a secret room accessible from the basement, with even more display cases for various unique items found throughout Skyrim .

14 Wind Path SSE

Downloads: 339,802

  • Creator: aukmat
  • Download Link

Wind Path is perfect for players who want to live in a small, yet comfortable house. Players can find it close to the town of Ivarstead by following the river past the bridge and down the hill. Those who want to enjoy a quiet and simple life will appreciate Wind Path.

The house has a homey and rustic feel that fills the player with warmth from the second they set foot inside. A must-have house mod in the load order, especially for players who love a more rugged home aesthetic.

13 Sicarius' Refuge SSE

Downloads: 364,718

  • Creator: Elianora - Leianne
  • Download Link

Sicarius' Refuge adds an assassin-themed house on the outskirts of Morthal, leaning into the aesthetic of a hidey hole of a wanted hitman who only needs a place to lie low while still having all the necessary amenities needed in a good player home. The mod also comes packaged with a unique armor set and a powerful dagger to continue with the Rogue theme.

Sicarius' Refuge is relatively small but comes absolutely packed with furniture, crafting tables, mannequins, storage cabinets, and hidden rooms. Best of all, the house also includes a unique dog companion who looks like a hellhound covered in dragonbone armor.

12 Hjertesten Hall

Downloads: 374,872

  • Creator: Thay S
  • Download Link

Given the sheer number of achievements players can undertake in Skyrim , it's easy to see why they'd want something in the world that reflects their greatness. Sure, owning a few properties in and around Skyrim can be pretty engaging in its own right, but what will really make things as engaging as possible is a huge estate that has so many things to take care of that players are encouraged to hire help.

From hosting feasts to getting married at the chapel on the property, there are many ways that Hjertesten Hall can be made as engaging as possible for the player. It's a house with a ton of fun interactions that make it one of the more fun Skyrim mods that players can mess around with.

11 Caranthir Tower Reborn SE

Downloads: 405,004

  • Creator: Darkfox127
  • Download Link

Deep within the mountains of Winterhold lies a broken-down wizard's tower called the Caranthir Tower . With enough skill and effort, players can build this tower back up to its former glory and claim it as their own (or pay someone a lot of gold to do it for them).

As a wizard's tower, the interiors and amenities mainly cater to mage characters. This doesn't simply mean an Enchanter's Table and an Alchemy Bench, but crafting stations to recharge an enchanted weapon's charge, call forth powerful entities as summons, and even writing spell tomes from scratch, which can later be either learned or sold. Once completed, the Caranthir Tower looks absolutely stunning and can easily serve as an endgame home for a magic-wielding Dragonborn.

10 Build Your Hearthfire Homes With Gold

Downloads: 716,179

  • Creator: Santala
  • Download Link

The Hearthfire DLC gave players a great option to build houses throughout Skyrim , but there's no denying that getting the materials required to make a proper house could be quite challenging. Players who want to avoid this grind can download this simple mod, allowing them to buy their way to success instead.

It's a great way for players to construct homes without cheating to get the required items. Given how much gold players can have in Skyrim , it's easy to see why this mod can be such a godsend for these players who hate having to collect items and hoarding up their inventory if they want to own a proper house.

9 Levelers Tower

Downloads: 762,947

  • Creator: WillieSea
  • Download Link

Levelers Tower is a great mod that lets players create a base that is absolutely decked out with a ton of features. From having an entire garden full to the brim with all the flora in Skyrim to a hub from which players can teleport wherever they want to, the possibilities of this hub are immense.

Players will have to spend some time learning the ins and outs of this mod, but the effort put into this task will be well worth it. There's no better Skyrim mod for players who want the best base possible.

8 The Scarlett - A Buildable Ship (SE)

Downloads: 767,484

  • Creator: Ld50365
  • Download Link

Utilizing a building system similar to Hearthfire's homesteads, The Scarlett allows players to build a ship they can live in and sail. Players will need to complete two small quests before they can work on the ship. It is located in a unique area that is accessed by reading a note placed at the East Empire Company building at the Solitude Docks.

The mod also adds an economic system through which players can enjoy a regular income source. The ship can be taken via fast travel to Windhelm, Winterhold, Solitude, and Solstheim, making it an all-purpose transport vehicle, as well as a floating player home.

7 Elysium Estate SSE

Downloads: 1,040,829

  • Creator: thejadeshadow
  • Download Link

Elysium Estate continues to be one of the best player homes ever made, thanks to its atmospheric and comfortable design; not to mention a wealth of beneficial add-ons. This home is located outside the walls of Whiterun near the Western Watchtower and can be accessed by completing a lore-friendly voiced quest that takes only a few minutes. This mod is geared towards family-oriented players who want to live in a house with their spouse, their adopted children, and perhaps a few followers.

The mod adds two indoor baths, an automatic loot sorting system, custom planters, and the option to purchase cows, goats, and chickens. It also features a grand basement with multiple mannequins to decorate with armor sets, plus interactive bookshelves, wall racks for shields, daggers, arrows, weapons, and unique items like Dragon claws, Thieves Guild treasures, and artifacts. It is highly suggested that Elysium Estate be paired with the Great Forest of Whiterun Hold mod for the ultimate atmospheric experience. Players just need to make sure to add the compatibility patch to their load order to prevent terrain conflicts.

6 HS Player Homes - Vlindrel Hall

Downloads: 1,072,399

  • Creator: Hylios Sykes
  • Download Link

While it's nice to use house mods that add new domiciles for players to mess around with in the game, the best mods are the ones that let players enjoy a nice facelift to the homes that are already in the game. Such is the case with this particular mod, that makes Vlindrel Hall one of the most picturesque homes the Dragonborn can visit during their adventures in Markanth.

The original floor plan is improved extensively, letting players enjoy a nice cozy home where they can relax with ease. The house is bigger and better than before, and certain aspects are expanded and unlocked if players become the Thane of Markanth. It's a nice way to make the game more immersive and let players enjoy the full extent of what a home in Skyrim can offer.

item.title: 7 Best Open-World Games With No Main Story
item.description:
Although a well-written and meaningful narrative can provide ample motivation to play through an open-world game, it can sometimes be used as a crutch; many narrative-driven titles that feature open worlds can often excel with their stories at the expense of engaging gameplay and detailed environments.

Though this isn't always the case, other open-world titles have explored gameplay loops that lack narrative entirely, instead focusing their designs on sandbox systems and engaging mechanics. Other titles, such as Project Zomboid , forfeit a narrative in favor of heavy simulation that facilitates emergent gameplay.

7 Mount & Blade: Warband

An Open-World Warfare Simulator

Mount & Blade: Warband is an open-world sandbox RPG that simulates open warfare with great detail. The game's lack of a core narrative thread leaves room for a great deal of player-agency, allowing players to gather armies and conquer the surrounding lands without interruption.

The game's simulation of large-scale battles is an obvious strength, providing immersive battlefields that encourage careful planning and strategic thinking. Furthermore, the game's fast overworld travel allows players to explore and battle with little downtime.

6 Project Zomboid

A Simulated Zombie Apocalypse In Open Environments

Project Zomboid is a painstaking simulation of a zombie apocalypse, packed with interlocking systems and game mechanics that offer constant challenges. The ever-present threat of the undead is paralleled by deep survival mechanics that constantly keep players on the move, forcing them to adapt to new threats in order to survive.

With no scripted narrative present, Project Zomboid offers organic storytelling that emerges as players explore and attempt to survive in its harsh world. These emergent narratives are all the more present when playing in co-op, where last-ditch efforts and last stands are made all the more memorable.

5 Slime Rancher

A Small-Scale, Cozy World

Slime Rancher is a bright and colorful indie game with a small-scale open-world that's fun to explore thanks to a lighthearted tone and accessible gameplay. The core gameplay loop revolves around farming crops and managing a variety of bubbly balls of slime, but exploring Slime Rancher's vibrant world is particularly fun.

The intuitiveness of the game's core tool, the vacpack, keeps gameplay free of tedium, allowing players to easily collect new slimes and gather helpful resources as they explore. But it's also the variety of landmarks, diverse environments, and unique slimes of each area that keep Slime Rancher rewarding, all without the presence of a main story.

4 Battle Brothers

Brutal Combat & Resource Management In An Open World

Battle Brothers is an open-world RPG that forgoes a main story and instead offers players a sandbox experience. Tasking players with the management of a mercenary company in a harsh and hostile low-fantasy world, Battle Brothers remains an engaging RPG despite its lack of story quests, thanks to a detailed and rewarding combat system.

The game's turn-based combat is entirely tactical, with each and every decision having clear consequences. This makes each move command, each attack, each use of an item an important one. Supported by a competent character progression system that promotes creative combinations and synergies, Battle Brothers is a title that will likely appeal to fans of combat-heavy RPGs.

3 Kenshi

A Sandbox RPG That Lets The Player Lead The Way

Kenshi is an open-world sandbox RPG with a unique and exotic setting that excels with its harsh and hostile environments. The game's overwhelmingly hostile design may be inaccessible at first, but proves a rewarding challenge to overcome for those who remain patient with it.

What makes Kenshi so rewarding is its complete lack of hand-holding, giving players no direction, including a complete lack of a main story. This puts a greater emphasis on player agency, encouraging players to take the reins and seek out their own goals.

2 The Long Dark

A Deeply Atmospheric Survival Simulator

The Long Dark is a survival game steeped in an immersive, tranquil atmosphere. Adding to this is a sharp ebb and flow of intense danger and moments of reprieve, brought about by an unforgiving set of simulated systems that make for a unique loop of heightened emotions.

The Long Dark's core survival mode, the default experience, features no story or even goals, other than to survive. However, this works in the game's favor, giving the dense atmosphere and survival gameplay room to breathe and allowing players to immerse themselves without interruption.

1 Terraria

Low-Stakes Survival That Encourages Creativity & Exploration

Terraria is a relaxing sandbox survival game with a colorful pixel-art style and a focus on creativity. In the game, players explore a randomly generated open world, crafting increasingly powerful items and providing homes for a variety of NPCs.

Exploring the game's dangerous underground caverns is particularly exciting, with a variety of biomes each hosting their own unique threats. The game's sandbox nature and focus on free-form exploration suits its total lack of narrative, also making Terraria a perfect fit for co-operative play.

item.title: Every Major Video Game Release Coming Soon For PC
item.description:
Quick Links

  • PC Games Coming Out In February 2025
  • PC Games Coming Out In March 2025
  • PC Games Coming Out In April 2025
  • PC Games Coming Out In May 2025
  • Major 2025 PC Games With Post-April Dates Or No Release Dates
  • Major Upcoming PC Games With No Release Year

PC players are nowadays seeing a lot of console-exclusive ports make their way to Steam and various launchers. This is great news for anyone who's felt like they've been missing out without owning a console, and it's clear that the lines between console and PC are beginning to blur, especially concerning Microsoft and its desire to port its impressive games' library to both ecosystems. PC Game Pass has made things even more lucrative and many series once thought console-locked forever are receiving PC versions (even if it takes a year or so to adapt them over).

Those playing games on a PC have a lot to look forward to in 2025 and beyond, with some high-profile ports, awesome-looking Indie releases, and AAA titles that are sure to look stunning on a high-end build. Here's a look at all the titles we can expect to see on the PC by the end of the year, along with games that do not have specific release dates.

What will be the best upcoming 2025 PC games ? Also, what could 2026 and beyond look like?

Please note that the upcoming calendar focuses on North American release dates.

Updated March 11, 2025 by Mark Sammut: The upcoming PC games were added to the calendar in the last two weeks: Care Bears: To The Rescue, Metal Bringer, Blue Prince, Promise Mascot Agency, Lushfoil Photography Sim, MotoGP 25, Blades of Fire, to a T, Farland Saga I & II Saturn Tribute, Terminator 2D: No Fate, The Phantom, Witchroid Vania: A Magical Girl's Fantastical Adventures, Which Way Up: Galaxy Games, Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 3 + 4, Outlawed, Asylum, Midnight Murder Club, Travel On, Pigeon!, Out of the Park Baseball 26, Mudborne: Frog Management Sim, Kaiserpunk, Dark Deity 2, Folklands, Edge Islands, Drive Beyond Horizons, Nordhold, Trials of Innocence, Spilled!, Your House, Emissary Zero, Sultan's Game, Let's Patiti!, Only Way is Down, Oddventure, Sand, Roman Triumph: Survival City Builder, Progress Orders

PC Games Coming Out In February 2025

Kingdom Come, Monster Hunter, Avowed, & More

February 2025 has offered something for nearly every PC user. 4X strategy fans have been treated to the latest entry in one of the genre's most decorated franchises: Civilization . The seventh mainline entry is finally here, and Civ 7 will stick around for a long, long time. Meanwhile, RPG fans who are craving a realistic trip to a bygone era can check out Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 . Niche as the original game is, its reputation has only grown over the years, setting the stage for a sequel that is bigger and better.

Avowed , Like a Dragon: Pirate Yakuza in Hawaii , and Monster Hunter Wilds are, frankly, way too big of games to release within 10 days of each other. For the most part, they have all received positive attention, and they are different enough that they all target somewhat different audiences.

PC Games Coming Out In March 2025

Two Point Museum, Assassin's Creed, & More

March is typically one of the busier months since it coincides with the end of the video game fiscal year, so publishers try to get a few big games out before the deadline. Consequently, March 2025 already has quite a few notable PC games, including Two Point Museum . The spiritual sequel will offer another accessible management sim with a humorous edge and surprising depth.

JRPG fans can check out Suikoden 1 & 2 HD Remaster or Atelier Yumia: The Alchemist of Memories & the Envisioned Land. Rise of the Ronin will be making its PC debut in March 2025.

PC Games Coming Out In April 2025

Fatal Fury The Last of Us, & More

April 2025 has developed nicely, even if the month will likely not be as stacked as either February or March. The Last of Us Part 2 Remastered is landing on PC, which should be a big deal since its predecessor has been available for a while. Even though it is more polarizing, the sequel is still among the best survival horror games. South of Midnight looks pretty great, particularly its setting and story. Commandos: Origins should keep tactics fans entertained, while the fighting genre will be receiving one of its biggest releases of the year in Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves .

PC Games Coming Out In May 2025

Doom, Elden Ring, Dune, & More

Following up on a decent but unspectacular April, May looks set to be one of the year's biggest months yet, with several major 2025 PC games announcing release dates. Doom: The Dark Ages will land on May 15, and it will almost certainly be one of the best FPS titles of 2025. Id Software has confirmed that Doom: Dark Ages will not include multiplayer and instead focus solely on single-player.

A few days later, Dune: Awakening will land on stores like Steam, granting players a chance to survive and thrive on Arrakis. May will come to an end with one of the entire year's most exciting projects: Elden Ring Nightreign . While a battle royale-esque multiplayer spin-off was probably not on most people's calendars for 2025, FromSoftware has not gone wrong with Elden Ring so far.

Major Upcoming PC Games With No Release Year

Hollow Knight, Star Citizen, & More

For some games, the hype train starts years before their debuts. While plenty of titles are slated to drop within 2025, quite a few projects have not revealed their release years. Games such as the new Tomb Raider or The Witcher are probably still a ways from completion, while others might announce plans to come out before the end of 2025. Then there are games like Bloodlines 2 , BioShock 4 , and Star Citizen that have been in development for years with no end in sight (currently).

item.title: Zenless Zone Zero: Pulchra Materials (Promotion, Skill & Core Skill Enhancement)
item.description:
Pulchra Fellini was first seen in Zenless Zone Zero as an enemy mob who belongs to the Pompey gang. However, as Pompey soon met his downfall, the title of Outer Ring Overlord was handed to Caesar, making the Sons of Calydon the alpha of the Outer Ring gangs.

Since Pulchra is practically a mercenary who only rolls with the strongest, it’s no surprise that she becomes a member of the Sons of Calydon. Players who are fans of this faction and plan to raise this feline-thiren can check this article for Pulchra materials in ZZZ .

Pulchra Materials In ZZZ - Zenless Zone Zero

Pulchra materials in ZZZ can be summarized as such:

  • Stun/Buster Certification Seal (Stun Materials)
  • Physical Chip (Physical Materials)
  • Higher Dimensional Data: Stealth Phantom (Normal Boss)
  • Scarlet Engine (Weekly Boss)
